content: Hello I’ll be visiting with 4 of my friends for my best friend’s bachelorette trip and hope to have an amazing time in Belize!

Hi Glenda,..Thank you for choosing our villa. We look forward to hosting you on your stay in Ambergris Caye, Belize...To further assist you, please download WhatsApp and save your personal concierge's number as it is the best way to communicate when on the island. ..Terri (Concierge).WhatsApp: 011.501.632.3404.Email: Email: terrialdana@gmail.com..We can assist you with all your travel needs, including reserving your travel to the island from Belize City, Golf Carts, the best excursions and adventures, villa prestock, chef services and more!  Get ready to sit back, and relax!  In the meantime, if you have any questions or need any recommendations, please don’t hesitate to ask....Thanks,.Sari & Terri
Thank you!

Hi Glenda, My name is Terri, I will be your concierge while staying with us. If you have any questions regarding your stay, tours, transportation to the island from the Belize International Airport, golf carts, tours, or anything concerning the island, please do not hesitate and do let us know
Hey Terri, thanks for reaching out! What are the transportation options from BZE airport to the villa?

.Plane vs water taxi:..\Water taxi:..Once you have landed at the international airport and finished with the customs department. Please head outside the international airport. Here you will see a variety of taxi cabs willing to take you to the water taxi terminal in Belize City (we can arrange this for you). The cost of the taxi cab is approximately 25.00 US for two persons and 10 US Dollars per additional person..After the 30 Minute taxi ride, you will get to the water taxi where you will purchase your water taxi tickets, the cost on this is 55 US Dollars round trip per person..Boat ride is 1 hr 45 min...If you allow me to book the boats for you, I can get the boat tickets at 45 US Dollars round trip per person..Plane:.Once you have arrived at the international airport in Belize City and cleared customs this is what will happen if you choose to come via plane. Inside the international airport you will head directly to your left you will see a kiosk that says Tropic Air, the cost is about 175 US Dollars round trip to San Pedro and back to the international airport per person. The flights leave every hour on the hour from San Pedro to Belize City and Belize City to the island. The flight itself is a beautiful low flying 15 minutes over the Caribbean. If you board first, you can sit next to the pilot!..Once you decide how you wish to come down to the island, I am more than happy to book a flight for you or water taxi.
Hello Terri! We are also interested in having a boat day. Do you know how we can rent a boat?

Here are a few excursions that you can think about and let me know which one you prefer:..HOL CHAN, SHARK RAY ALLEY: .Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat with pick up from the property for 1/2 day. ..CAYE CAULKER SAIL:.On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley (swim with sharks and sting rays). Then you'll head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..Then you'll head back to the boat where you'll enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches!.The cost is $95 plus taxes & park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran, must go into town)..SPEED BOAT - 1/2 day TOUR .8:30am or 1:30pm pick up.Head to holchan and shark ray alley.Cost is 75 plus park fees & taxes.Pick up in town would be 55 plus taxes & Fees..THE GRAND SLAM -.Cost $175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat..8 am & returns at 4 pm.Snorkel at Holchan, Shark Ray Alley & the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses mother nature permitting), feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included), plus park fees and taxes..BEACH BBQ:.My personal top favorite, is the Beach BBQ day, the cost is $650 plus taxes..On this day you'll Snorkel, Fish, Spearfish, Lobster Hunt, Conch Hunt (Only if in season) and have a Beach BBQ cookout on a private beach & enjoy your catch! Ceviche Belizean grilled fish, Rum punches & more!.Price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 USD per additional person..These are some of the options on full day tours

Renting a boat to go on your own is not possible, since one of the major laws in the country of Belize is that you must have a captain boat license issued in Belize. The reason is because of our reef and some parts of the ocean having shallow water and others have coral head just popping out of no where.
Hi Glenda you can certainly rent a boat with a boat captain for the day as a part of your Belize Adventure! The Grand Slam and Beach BBQ are the best private boat trip experiences!

Glenda, just to clarify, if you want to rent a boat for yourself and drive it yourself, which is not allowed in the country of Belize, you will need a Belizean boat captain license. You can do all day private tour on a boat, like Sari mentioned the Grand Slam and the beach bbq are great options
Hello! Sorry on the late response! We will clarify about the boat later. But we would like to know if we can ship Amazon packages to the Airbnb? Not sure if that’s a possibility

Hi Glenda! I don't know if you can ship to Belize from the US as US Amazon doesn't ship out of the US, you would have to order from Belize Amazon and you'd have to have them sent to town post office.  I don't think it would be cost effective.  Would be best for you to bring with you from the states.
Hi Sari! I'll be visiting with some friends just to get out of the country, get some sun and celebrate our friends engagement anniversary! So excited about this trip :)

Awesome
Hey terri someone in the group was wondering how late the ferry will operate from Belize city to San Pedro,.Thanks!
5:30 PM is the last water taxi to the island
Gotcha, what would be the easiest way for my friend to get to the island if she’s getting in later than that?
by plane, what time is her international flight arriving?
So she’s arriving at 3:30, but I guess she’s worried about flight delays/customs taking awhile and missing the ferry

yes, thats a headache with customs, I highly recommend flying. Just had delays last week on the flight that lands at 3:30 and Tropic Air waited for all guest to arrive and left after 7pm from Belize..The boats do not wait
Gotcha thank you :) and we were considering renting ATVs instead of golf carts to get around is that possible?
They don't have ATV rentals here. Only 1 tour company that does tours on ATVs
Hey walker,  Zach asked me to share this info here:

To get to the island:..We are located on the island of Ambergris Caye also known as Belize's Isla Bonita, made most famous by Madonna's 80s hit! San Pedro is Ambergris Caye. From your arrival at the Philip Goldson International Airport in Belize City you can connect at the airport and take a beautiful 15 minute low flying flight over the Caribbean to San Pedro Town or you can take the ferry.  The flight feels like a mini tour in and of itself, if you board first you can sit next to the pilot. ..To catch the ferry we'llhave a cab driver pick you up at the airport and take you 45 mins to the ferry station.  The ferry will add approximately 2.5 hours or more to your travel day. ..Whichever option you prefer,  Ms. Terri, your personal concierge while staying with us can reserve either travel accommodation to the island on your behalf.  All we need is your international flight details and names as they appear on your passports. ....When renting a golf cart with us, Ms Terri, your personal concierge, will greet you upon arrival to the island at either San Pedro ferry boat drop off or Tropic Air airport. We'll provide 1 complimentary escort to the villa north of town with a luggage carrier in addition to your cart and stop at the local grocery (time permitting). Golf cart parking is to the left after entering the property from the north highway through the main gate...The road could be bumpy with pot holes depending on rains and the last time the town repaved. Does anyone in the group have serious spine injuries?
Hey walker! Was talking to Zach, here's the info on the tours.

Here is a quick high level list of Tours & adventures: scuba diving, snorkeling, hol chan marine reserve, bacalar chico, mexico rocks, blue hole, cave tubing,  Mayan ruins, the zoo (hand feed the jaguars), parasailing, jet skiing, fishing,  fly-fishing, spear fishing,  kayaking, paddleboard, deep sea and game fishing, caye hop, feed the tarpons, croc or wildlife tours,  snorkel or swim with manatees (mother nature permitting), Grand Slam,  Beach BBQ,  and more! ..Here is more of a Breakdown for some Belize Adventure Highlights:..MAYAN RUIN, Lamanai:.Lamanai Mayan Ruins, on this trip, you get picked up on property at 5am, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the Northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Cost: 280 USD per person, plus taxes. Picks up at the property and includes, breakfast, and lunch..MAYA RUIN XUNATUNICH, CAVE TUBING, ZIP LINING AND/OR THE BELIZE ZOO (3 IN 1 DAY):.The Maya Ruin Xunatunich Ruins adventure can be joined with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 300 depending on what you want to do. You can also do a 3 in 1 day and choose from the Mayan ruins, cave tubing, zip lining or the zoo (for an extra fee you can hand feed the jaguars at the zoo,  really neat for big animal lovers). This includes breakfast and lunch...HOL CHAN, SHARK RAY ALLEY:.Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat with pick up from the property for 1/2 day. I always encourage pick up tours...CAYE CAULKER SAIL:.On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley (swim with sharks and sting rays). Then you'll head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..Then you'll head back to the boat where you'll enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches!.The cost is $95 plus taxes & park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran, must go into town)..SPEED BOAT - Private TOUR.8:30am or 1:30pm pick up.Head to holchan and shark ray alley.Cost is 75 plus park fees & taxes..THE GRAND SLAM - .Cost $175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat..8 am & returns at 4 pm.Snorkel at Holchan, Shark Ray Alley & the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses mother nature permitting), feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included)..BEACH BBQ: .My personal top favorite, is the Beach BBQ day, the cost is $650 plus taxes..On this day you'll Snorkel, Fish, Spearfish, Lobster Hunt, Conch Hunt (Only if in season) and have a Beach BBQ cookout on a private beach & enjoy your catch! Ceviche Belizean grilled fish, Rum punches & more! .Price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 USD per additional person
If you have any other questions, please do not hesitate and do let us know

Walker, the blue hole trip is an early morning one. Pick up is at Costa blue at 5:15 am.Return time is at 5 ish pm..This is a three dives tour or three snorkeling stops. Depending on what you prefer..The blue hole is 54 miles away or 2 1/2 hrs boat ride.The first stop is at the blue hole.Second stop at half moon caye.We also have lunch here and view the red footed booby birds..The third stop is at the aquarium ..Breakfast and lunch are provided on this trip. .Cost is 285 US dollars ➕️ equipment plus taxes ➕️ park fees (40 us dollars) this is per person. ..Please note that prices may change on tours due to increases in gas, which is beyond our control
Thank you so much for the info, do you know around how much it would be if we were to do the 3 in 1 Mayan ruins tubing ziplining experience ?
And also for that, how would transportation work? Do we need to get to the mainland ourselves for pickup or would we get picked up from the Airbnb
You would get picked up from the estate.
I'm confirming the 3 in 1 rate. I should know by the morning.. myself or miss Terri will reach out.

So when it comes to the all-in-one-day Walker, the price you pay depends on how you want to do the trip, for example,.If you wish to get picked up at the villa the cost is 350 US Dollars per person, and they will pick you up at about 5:00 in the morning, provide a quick-to-go breakfast, and set you on the water taxi (public transportation), your guide will be waiting for you in Belize city with a private air-conditioned van and will take you to do your tours, lunch is included, please. Or, you can go with the smaller mom-and-pop tour company, and you will get yourself to town and be there for the 6 am water taxi (I can help you purchase your boat tickets at a lower cost.), breakfast is provided by you. In Belize City, your private guide will be waiting for you in a private air-conditioned van and he will take you to do your tours, the cost of this is 185 US Dollars per person, and lunch is included. Transportation to Belize City from the island is not included.. Taxes are not included in both prices...Let me know which one you prefer to do and I will book immediately for you

Hi we are looking to book your home early August. ..Questions I have are:..1. From the airport or the water taxi port how do we get to your home? Taxi, gold cart etc?..2. Grocery store to stock up on items to eat and  drink?..3. How do we get to like a snorkel tour etc from the home? Will the golf cart be sufficient to get to town to get on these tours?..4. If we wanted to fish of the pier, do you have fishing roads or are the places to rent them?..5. Saw that you offer chef service? How much does that cost?..Thank you.Abe.

Hi Abe,.Thank you for your inquiry! We’d love to host you your Belize getaway!..1.	A golf cart is the best way to adventure the island! When renting a cart with us, Ms Terri your personal concierge while staying with us will greet you upon arrival once on island (@ either the water taxi terminal or the airport) and personally escort you to the villa with a luggage carryall!  You can also always select to take a cab to the villa as well which will run you approximately $80 one way as cars are very expensive to import to our little island..2.	We have several small local groceries next to the estate, just a quarter mile down the road. We also offer villa pre-stocking as an option for our guests!  We also have groceries from town that we work with that will deliver to the estate – just speak with Terri, your concierge. ..3.	Terri, your personal Concierge, can arrange all excursions for you. We always encourage tour operators that pick up from property which will enhance your overall experience! We don’t markup excursions & tours. Ms. Terri is a 25-year tour operator and local and can help provide you the best excursions and adventures with the best operators for the best rates available! The golf cart is sufficient to get around the island and explore its attractions and is highly encouraged so that you can adventure and see all the island has to offer...4.	If you want to fish off the pier, you can bring your own fishing rods or rent them from town. We do not have fishing poles on site...5.	We do offer chef service upon request. The cost vastly varies depending on chef, menu, # of persons and meal service (breakfast, lunch, dinner). We also have a partner restaurant that delivers in villa room service.  If you preselect food and beverage service for your stay it’s $75 per person - breakfast, lunch, and dinner for option selected at least 1 week prior to arrival). We also offer breakfast at a preset rate of $8 per person per day for the entirety of your stay with us.  We must be notified in advance if you would like to select either food and beverage option to secure this rate for your stay with us.  You can always order from the restaurant menu a la carte and service can be delivered to your villa. Menus are available in the villas...We look forward to hosting you!.Best regards, Sari

Hi Bobby!..So excited your time with us is almost here! Ms. Terri can book all excursions and tours for you, she's a 25 year tour operator and has access to the best guides for the best rates. There is no mark up on rates -  using her guides has always proven to be better overall experiences for our guests vs booking on your own.  Plus having guides that pick up on property will only enhance your overall experience and are can coordinate our reschedule where and when needed if adventures need to be rescheduled due to weather disruptions.

Here is a quick high level list of Tours & adventures: scuba diving, snorkeling, hol chan marine reserve, bacalar chico, mexico rocks, blue hole, cave tubing,  Mayan ruins, the zoo (hand feed the jaguars), parasailing, jet skiing, fishing,  fly-fishing, spear fishing,  kayaking, paddleboard, deep sea and game fishing, caye hop, feed the tarpons, croc or wildlife tours,  snorkel or swim with manatees (mother nature permitting), Grand Slam,  Beach BBQ,  and more! ..Here is more of a Breakdown for some Belize Adventure Highlights:..MAYAN RUIN, Lamanai:.Lamanai Mayan Ruins, on this trip, you get picked up on property at 5am, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the Northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Cost: 280 USD per person, plus taxes. Picks up at the property and includes, breakfast, and lunch..MAYA RUIN XUNATUNICH, CAVE TUBING, ZIP LINING AND/OR THE BELIZE ZOO (3 IN 1 DAY):.The Maya Ruin Xunatunich Ruins adventure can be joined with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 350 depending on what you want to do. You can also do a 3 in 1 day and choose from the Mayan ruins, cave tubing, zip lining or the zoo (for an extra fee you can hand feed the jaguars at the zoo,  really neat for big animal lovers). This includes breakfast and lunch...HOL CHAN, SHARK RAY ALLEY:.Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat with pick up from the property for 1/2 day. I always encourage pick up tours...CAYE CAULKER SAIL:.On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley (swim with sharks and sting rays). Then you'll head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..Then you'll head back to the boat where you'll enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches!.The cost is $95 plus taxes & park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran, must go into town)..SPEED BOAT - Private TOUR.8:30am or 1:30pm pick up.Head to holchan and shark ray alley up to 6 persons.Cost is 75 plus park fees & taxes .*If less than 6 persons another group may join, up to 6. ..THE GRAND SLAM - .Cost $175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat..8 am & returns at 4 pm.Snorkel at Holchan, Shark Ray Alley & the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses mother nature permitting), feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included)..BEACH BBQ: .My personal top favorite, is the Beach BBQ day, the cost is $650 plus taxes..On this day you'll Snorkel, Fish, Spearfish, Lobster Hunt, Conch Hunt (Only if in season) and have a Beach BBQ cookout on a private beach & enjoy your catch! Ceviche Belizean grilled fish, Rum punches & more! .Price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 USD per additional person

Not sure Antyon, if you know that there are two ways to get to the island from the Belize Internation airport, you can either come by boat or by plane...Plane vs boat:..Plane vs water taxi:..\Water taxi:..Once you have landed at the international airport and finished with the customs department. Please head outside the international airport. Here you will see a variety of taxi cabs willing to take you to the water taxi terminal in Belize City (we can arrange this for you). The cost of the taxi cab is approximately 25.00 US for two persons and 10 US Dollars per additional person..After the 30 Minute taxi ride, you will get to the water taxi where you will purchase your water taxi tickets, the cost on this is 55 US Dollars round trip per person..Boat ride is 1 hr 45 min...If you allow me to book the boats for you, I can get the boat tickets at 45 US Dollars round trip per person..Plane:.Once you have arrived at the international airport in Belize City and cleared customs this is what will happen if you choose to come via plane. Inside the international airport you will head directly to your left you will see a kiosk that says Tropic Air, the cost is about 175 US Dollars round trip to San Pedro and back to the international airport per person. The flights leave every hour on hour from San Pedro to Belize City and Belize City to the island. The flight itself is a beautiful low flying 15 minutes over the Caribbean. If you board first, you can sit next to the pilot!..Once you decide how you wish to come down to the island, I am more than happy to book a flight for you or water taxi. .Its better if I book for you, the reason is that I like that I will know what time you will be getting to the island.

Once on the island, if you rent a golf cart from us, I will be waiting for you when you arrive here on the island. We then drive toward the golf cart company, do all the paperwork, and from there we drive to the grocery shop and then home. A golf cart cost is 170 US Dollars plus taxes and 25 for insurance..If you decide not to rent a golf cart, you will need to get a taxi cab to the villa from San Pedro, the cab will charge you 75 US dollars one way...If you have any other questions regarding the island, your stay, golf carts, tours, or anything you might be thinking of, please do not hesitate and do let us know.

Hey Josh!

We're located on belizes most famous island of Ambergris Caye also known as Belize's Isla Bonita, made most famous by Madonna's 80s hit! From your arrival at the Philip Goldson International Airport in Belize City you can connect at the airport and take a beautiful 15 minute low flying flight over the Caribbean to San Pedro Town on Ambergris or you can take the ferry.  The flight feels like a mini tour in and of itself, if you board first you can sit next to the pilot. ..To catch the ferry we'll have a cab driver pick you up at the airport and take you 45 mins to the ferry station.  The ferry will add approximately 2.5 hours or more to your travel day. ..Whichever option you prefer,  Ms. Terri, your personal concierge while staying with us can reserve either travel accommodation to the island on your behalf.  All we need is your international flight details and names as they appear on your passports. Once you book your international flight details please share them with us.

When you rent a cart with us, Ms. Terri will greet you upon arrival at either the ferry or airport with your golf cart and a carryall to transfer luggage and escort you to the villa for check in and departure.  1 complimentary escort service is included for arrival and departure.
Hey Josh,  Alejo reached out asking for tour info:

Here is a quick high level list of Tours & adventures: scuba diving, snorkeling, hol chan marine reserve, bacalar chico, mexico rocks, blue hole, cave tubing,  Mayan ruins, the zoo (hand feed the jaguars), parasailing, jet skiing, fishing,  fly-fishing, spear fishing,  kayaking, paddleboard, deep sea and game fishing, caye hop, feed the tarpons, croc or wildlife tours,  snorkel or swim with manatees (mother nature permitting), Grand Slam,  Beach BBQ,  and more! ..Here is more of a Breakdown for some Belize Adventure Highlights:..MAYAN RUIN, Lamanai:.Lamanai Mayan Ruins, on this trip, you get picked up on property at 5am, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the Northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Cost: 280 USD per person, plus taxes. Picks up at the property and includes, breakfast, and lunch..MAYA RUIN XUNATUNICH, CAVE TUBING, ZIP LINING AND/OR THE BELIZE ZOO (3 IN 1 DAY):.The Maya Ruin Xunatunich Ruins adventure can be joined with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 300 depending on what you want to do. You can also do a 3 in 1 day and choose from the Mayan ruins, cave tubing, zip lining or the zoo (for an extra fee you can hand feed the jaguars at the zoo,  really neat for big animal lovers). The main mode of transportation on the island is via golf cart. Especially with us being 9 miles north, this is the easiest, cheapest and safest way to travel. A taxi cab, will charge you 75 US Dollars for one way to get you to the villa, so a round trip would be 150 US Dollars, in one day. A golf cart on the other hand would be for 386.00 US Dollars plus taxes + 25 for insurance, this is for your entire stay. .Personally this is the method to go. If you want to go to secret beach, a cab charges 100 US Dollars one way on this. This is an approximation, it can be more, depending on the cab driver you get

Once you rent the cart, I will be at the airport with your golf cart and mines of course for luggage, you will drive your cart, we will do a stop at the golf cart company and pay for the cart, and also at the grocery shop, where we will buy groceries and then we head home
If you wait until you get here to rent a cart, you run the risk of not getting any or if you do get, the prices are sky high

To noodle on some adventures you may want to try: .. Here is a quick high level list of Tours & adventures: scuba diving, snorkeling, hol chan marine reserve, bacalar chico, mexico rocks, blue hole, cave tubing,  Mayan ruins, the zoo (hand feed the jaguars), parasailing, jet skiing, fishing,  fly-fishing, spear fishing,  kayaking, paddleboard, deep sea and game fishing, caye hop, feed the tarpons, croc or wildlife tours,  snorkel or swim with manatees (mother nature permitting), Grand Slam,  Beach BBQ,  and more! ..Here is more of a Breakdown for some Belize Adventure Highlights:..MAYAN RUIN, Lamanai:.Lamanai Mayan Ruins, on this trip, you get picked up on property at 5am, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the Northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Cost: 280 USD per person, plus taxes. Picks up at the property and includes, breakfast, and lunch..MAYA RUIN XUNATUNICH, CAVE TUBING, ZIP LINING AND/OR THE BELIZE ZOO (3 IN 1 DAY):.The Maya Ruin Xunatunich Ruins adventure can be joined with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 300 depending on what you want to do. You can also do a 3 in 1 day and choose from the Mayan ruins, cave tubing, zip lining or the zoo (for an extra fee you can hand feed the jaguars at the zoo,  really neat for big animal lovers). This includes breakfast and lunch...HOL CHAN, SHARK RAY ALLEY:.Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat with pick up from the property for 1/2 day. I always encourage pick up tours...CAYE CAULKER SAIL:.On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley (swim with sharks and sting rays). Then you'll head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..Then you'll head back to the boat where you'll enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches!.The cost is $95 plus taxes & park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran, must go into town)..SPEED BOAT - Private TOUR.8:30am or 1:30pm pick up.Head to holchan and shark ray alley.Cost is 75 plus park fees & taxes..THE GRAND SLAM - .Cost $175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat..8 am & returns at 4 pm.Snorkel at Holchan, Shark Ray Alley & the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses mother nature permitting), feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included)..BEACH BBQ: .My personal top favorite, is the Beach BBQ day, the cost is $650 plus taxes..On this day you'll Snorkel, Fish, Spearfish, Lobster Hunt, Conch Hunt (Only if in season) and have a Beach BBQ cookout on a private beach & enjoy your catch! Ceviche Belizean grilled fish, Rum punches & more! .Price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 USD per additional person

No problem Birgit, sorry for the delay:.Plane vs Water taxi..Plane:.Once you have arrived at the international airport in Belize City and cleared customs this is what will happen if you choose to come via plane. Inside the international airport you will head directly to your left you will see a kiosk that says Tropic Air, the cost is about 168.50 US Dollars round trip to San Pedro and back to the international airport per person. The flights leave every hour on the hour from Belize City and from the island back to Belize International airport every hours. You need to be at the international airport at least 3 hours prior to your departure from Belize back home. So keep this in mind when booking your flight. Once you have booked your flight, relax and wait, the plane ride is only 15 minutes long, Whoopi!..Water taxi:.Once you have landed at the international airport and finished with the custom department. Please head outside the international airport. Here you will see a variety of taxi cabs willing to take you to the water taxi terminal in Belize City. The cost on the taxi cab is approximately 25.00 US for two persons and 10 US Dollars per additional person...Once you have arrived at the water taxi terminal please go ahead and purchase your ticket there and then. The cost on this is 60 US Dollars per person round trip (this price may vary depending on the season)...We have kayak and paddle boards available, you get to choose one day where we offer 2 hrs. complimentary usage of 1 kayak and a paddle board..If you would like to rent we can rent you for 120 US Dollars for the week..Even though you can take these to the reef there is nothing better than actually taking you out on a boat, for example on the kayak you cannot reach to holchan marine reserve or shark ray alley or Mexico rocks and tres cocos

The Blue Hole trip starts at 5:15 in the morning and you will drive on a boat for 2 and 1/2 hrs, waves can get pretty intense, there are a total of three dives, the first one is the Blue Hole itself, this is 120 feet dive and you need to have recent dives in order to this..When was the last time you went diving, do you have your dive card with you. If it is been more than a year you do need to do a refresher course.

my top favorite ruin is Lamanai, on this trip, you get picked up at 6:30 in the morning, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Costs 220 US Dollars per person, plus taxes. includes, breakfast, and lunch..You can also do the Maya Ruin Xunatunich and join it with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go from 240 to 260 depending on what you want, or you.can do the three in one day and the cost on this is 285 Plus taxes...Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat for 1/2 day.Caye Caulker sail..On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley. We will then head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..We then go back to the boat where we enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches.The cost is 95 plus taxes and park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm..Speed boat -.you choose the time either 8:30 pick up or 1:30 pick up.we go to holchan and shark ray alley and come back home.The cost is 55 plus park fees and taxes..Grand slam - cost is 157.75 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat - leaves at 8 am and returns at 4 pm.We snorkel at holchan, shark ray alley, the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses), we feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included..My top favorite, beach bbq day, the cost is 500 plus taxes, we snorkel, fish, spearfish, lobster hunt, conch hun (Only if in season) and cook everything on the beach when we are done.The price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 75 US Dollars extra per person.for..Please note that prices that I sent you do not include pick up, you would be meeting them in town. If you prefer pick up at the villa, the only trips that will not do pick up will be the Blue Hole and the Catamaran tour

Hi Jenni,  Ms. Terri your personal concierge will help schedule all your adventures including spear fishing. Here is a quick high level list of Tours & adventures: scuba diving, snorkeling, hol chan marine reserve, bacalar chico, mexico rocks, blue hole, cave tubing,  Mayan ruins, the zoo (hand feed the jaguars), parasailing, jet skiing, fishing,  fly-fishing, spear fishing,  kayaking, paddleboard, deep sea and game fishing, caye hop, feed the tarpons, croc or wildlife tours,  snorkel or swim with manatees (mother nature permitting), Grand Slam,  Beach BBQ,  and more! ..Here is more of a Breakdown for some Belize Adventure Highlights:..MAYAN RUIN, Lamanai:.Lamanai Mayan Ruins, on this trip, you get picked up on property at 5am, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the Northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Cost: 280 USD per person, plus taxes. Picks up at the property and includes, breakfast, and lunch..MAYA RUIN XUNATUNICH, CAVE TUBING, ZIP LINING AND/OR THE BELIZE ZOO (3 IN 1 DAY):.The Maya Ruin Xunatunich Ruins adventure can be joined with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 300 depending on what you want to do. You can also do a 3 in 1 day and choose from the Mayan ruins, cave tubing, zip lining or the zoo (for an extra fee you can hand feed the jaguars at the zoo,  really neat for big animal lovers). This includes breakfast and lunch...HOL CHAN, SHARK RAY ALLEY:.Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat with pick up from the property for 1/2 day. I always encourage pick up tours...CAYE CAULKER SAIL:.On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley (swim with sharks and sting rays). Then you'll head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..Then you'll head back to the boat where you'll enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches!.The cost is $95 plus taxes & park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran, must go into town)..SPEED BOAT - Private TOUR.8:30am or 1:30pm pick up.Head to holchan and shark ray alley.Cost is 75 plus park fees & taxes..THE GRAND SLAM - .Cost $175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat..8 am & returns at 4 pm.Snorkel at Holchan, Shark Ray Alley & the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses mother nature permitting), feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included)..BEACH BBQ: .My personal top favorite, is the Beach BBQ day, the cost is $650 plus taxes..On this day you'll Snorkel, Fish, Spearfish, Lobster Hunt, Conch Hunt (Only if in season) and have a Beach BBQ cookout on a private beach & enjoy your catch! Ceviche Belizean grilled fish, Rum punches & more! .Price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 USD per additional person

There are two primary ways to arrive to the island.  1. Is by flight right from the international airport. It's a short 15 min beautiful low lying flight over the Caribbean. After a long day traveling this is the easiest way to get into San Pedro.
2. Take the ferry over.  After arriving at the international airport we can arrange to have our cab driver pick you up and drive you about 40 mins to the ferry station.
From there he'll pick up your tickets and you'll board the ferry.  It's about 1.5 hours to the island.  All in travel time about 2.5 hours.

Plane vs Water taxi to island..Plane:.Once you have arrived at the international airport in Belize City and cleared customs this is what will happen if you choose to come via plane. Inside the international airport you will head directly to your left you will see a kiosk that says Tropic Air, the cost is about 175 US Dollars round trip to San Pedro and back to the international airport per person. The flights leave every hour on the hour from San Pedro to Belize City and Belize City to the island. Technically you should be at the airport 2 hours before departing back stateside. The flight itself is a beautiful low flying 15 minutes over the Caribbean. If you board first, you can sit next to the pilot!..Water taxi:.Once you have landed at the international airport and finished with the custom department. Please head outside the international airport. Here you will see a variety of taxi cabs willing to take you to the water taxi terminal in Belize City (we can arrange this for you). The cost on the taxi cab is approximately 25.00 US for two persons and 10 US Dollars per additional person...Once you have arrived at the water taxi terminal please go ahead and purchase your ticket there and then. The cost on this is 55 US Dollars per person round trip (this price may vary depending on the season)...Personally due to the amount of travel time, I prefer the plane..

Golf carts are the easiest mode of transportation are golf carts. .The cost on a four-seater is for your entire stay is 300 plus taxes. This is per cart..For a six-seater the cost for your entire stay is 500 plus taxes (prices are in US dollars)

Lamanai, on this trip, you get picked up at5 in the morning, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Costs 280 US Dollars per person, plus taxes. includes, breakfast, and lunch..You can also do the Maya Ruin Xunatunich and join it with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 300 depending on what you want, or you..Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat for 1/2 day.Caye Caulker sail..On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley. We will then head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..We then go back to the boat where we enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches.The cost is 95 plus taxes and park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran)..Speed boat -.you choose the time either 8:30 pick up or 1:30 pick up.we go to holchan and shark ray alley and come back home.The cost is 75 plus park fees and taxes..Grand slam - cost is 175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat - leaves at 8 am and returns at 4 pm.We snorkel at holchan, shark ray alley, the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses), we feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included..My top favorite, beach bbq day, the cost is 650 plus taxes, we snorkel, fish, spearfish, lobster hunt, conch hun (Only if in season) and cook everything on the beach when we are done.The price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 US Dollars extra per person.for

If you want a chef for the week, Ms. Terri can quote with our chef what the cost would be for the week.  What I would suggest is doing Breakfast with our restaurant. And then do dinner service for the week with the chef.  If I may suggest, keeping your lunch option open - this way you can adventure the island and use lunch as a part of this exploration!  This way, you have the best of both worlds!..Some suggestions: There is a fantastic lunch Food Tour where you experience local cuisine in town, one day you may adventure to Secret Beach (where there is a plethora of restaurants), another day I would suggest do the Grand Slam, Caye hop to Caye Caulker and lunch there, and another day - check out the Beach BBQ, where our boat captain will pick you up at the property.  You'll fish 2 different locations, and snorkel in different locations, while snorkeling you'll hunt for conch (if in season) and spearfish - once your boating adventure is complete, you'll dock on a private beach and the Boat Captain, and your chef will prepare your catch - and you will eat your catch! :)

The helicopter tour over the blue hole is beautiful! It is one of the more pricey tours.
If you love the water,  I would encourage snorkeling shark ray alley. It's super neat swimming with the nurse sharks,  something you'll remember forever.

My personal favorite is the Beach BBQ (pick up on property, fish 2 different locations,  snorkel 2 different locations and hunt (spear fish / free dive) for conch and/or lobster based on seasonality) then the captain will cook your catch and you'll have a picnic on a private beach! My other favorite is a full day tour where you can choose 3 of the following options: Mayan ruins,  ziplining, Belize zoo (you can hand feed the jaguars for an extra fee) 😀  or cave tubing. It's a super long day but you jam pack a full day of adventures and experiences!
Ones that you'll remember for life!

Here is a quick high level list of Tours & adventures: scuba diving, snorkeling, hol chan marine reserve, bacalar chico, mexico rocks, blue hole, cave tubing,  Mayan ruins, the zoo (hand feed the jaguars), parasailing, jet skiing, fishing,  fly-fishing, spear fishing,  kayaking, paddleboard, deep sea and game fishing, caye hop, feed the tarpons, croc or wildlife tours,  snorkel or swim with manatees (mother nature permitting), Grand Slam,  Beach BBQ,  and more! ..Here is more of a Breakdown for some Belize Adventure Highlights:..MAYAN RUIN, Lamanai:.Lamanai Mayan Ruins, on this trip, you get picked up on property at 5am, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the Northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Cost: 280 USD per person, plus taxes. Picks up at the property and includes, breakfast, and lunch..MAYA RUIN XUNATUNICH, CAVE TUBING, ZIP LINING AND/OR THE BELIZE ZOO (3 IN 1 DAY):.The Maya Ruin Xunatunich Ruins adventure can be joined with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 300 depending on what you want to do. You can also do a 3 in 1 day and choose from the Mayan ruins, cave tubing, zip lining or the zoo (for an extra fee you can hand feed the jaguars at the zoo,  really neat for big animal lovers). This includes breakfast and lunch...HOL CHAN, SHARK RAY ALLEY:.Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat with pick up from the property for 1/2 day. I always encourage pick up tours...CAYE CAULKER SAIL:.On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley (swim with sharks and sting rays). Then you'll head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..Then you'll head back to the boat where you'll enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches!.The cost is $95 plus taxes & park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran, must go into town)..SPEED BOAT - Private TOUR.8:30am or 1:30pm pick up.Head to holchan and shark ray alley.Cost is 75 plus park fees & taxes..THE GRAND SLAM - .Cost $175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat..8 am & returns at 4 pm.Snorkel at Holchan, Shark Ray Alley & the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses mother nature permitting), feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included)..BEACH BBQ: .My personal top favorite, is the Beach BBQ day, the cost is $650 plus taxes..On this day you'll Snorkel, Fish, Spearfish, Lobster Hunt, Conch Hunt (Only if in season) and have a Beach BBQ cookout on a private beach & enjoy your catch! Ceviche Belizean grilled fish, Rum punches & more! .Price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 USD per additional person

So in all, you will add almost 3 hrs more of traveling...The second method is via plane, the cost is 168.50 US Dollars. There are two ways to arrive to the island,.Water taxi and plane..Water taxi:.Once you have landed at the international airport and finished with the custom department. Please head outside the international airport. Here you will see a variety of taxi cabs willing to take you to the water taxi terminal in Belize City (we can arrange this for you). The cost on the taxi cab is approximately 25.00 US for two persons and 10 US Dollars per additional person...Once you have arrived at the water taxi terminal please go ahead and purchase your ticket there and then. The cost on this is 60 US Dollars per person round trip (this price may vary depending on the season)...Plane:.Once you have arrived at the international airport in Belize City and cleared customs this is what will happen if you choose to come via plane. Inside the international airport you will head directly to your left you will see a kiosk that says Tropic Air, the cost is about 176.50 US Dollars round trip to San Pedro and back to the international airport per person. The flights leave every hour on the hour from San Pedro to Belize City and Belize City to the island. Technically you should be at the airport 2 hours before departing back stateside. The flight itself is a beautiful low flying 15 minutes over the Caribbean. If you board first, you can sit next to the pilot!

Golf cart is the best mode of transportation once you arrive to the island is via golf cart, the cost of a golf on a four-seater is 170 US Dollars plus taxes. .For golf cart rental, we are more than happy to book this for you, if you book with me, I will be picking you up with your golf cart at either the water taxi or airport in San Pedro and bringing you to the villa, my golf cart will be there to bring your luggage...Lamanai, on this trip, you get picked up at5 in the morning, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Costs 280 US Dollars per person, plus taxes. includes, breakfast, and lunch..You can also do the Maya Ruin Xunatunich and join it with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go up to 300 depending on what you want, or you..Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat for 1/2 day.Caye Caulker sail..On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley. We will then head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..We then go back to the boat where we enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches.The cost is 95 plus taxes and park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm (pick up not included since its on a catamaran)..Speed boat -.you choose the time either 8:30 pick up or 1:30 pick up.we go to holchan and shark ray alley and come back home.The cost is 75 plus park fees and taxes..Grand slam - cost is 175 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat - leaves at 8 am and returns at 4 pm.We snorkel at holchan, shark ray alley, the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses), we feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included..My top favorite, beach bbq day, the cost is 650 plus taxes, we snorkel, fish, spearfish, lobster hunt, conch hunt (Only if in season) and cook everything on the beach when we are done.The price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 95 US Dollars extra per person

All I need is your names in full and your international flight information, round trip, and for you to tell me which mode of transportation you prefer. As you know there are two options of coming to the island:.The water taxi is the cheapest option but also the longest one. The cost is 55 US Dollars round trip per person and the boat ride is 1 hr 45 minutes. You will also need to hire a taxi to take you to the water taxi terminal in Belize City. This cost is 25 US Dollars for two persons and 10 US Dollars per additional person, the travel time from the water taxi to the cab is 30 minutes. So in all, you will add almost 3 hrs more of traveling...The second method is via plane, the cost is 168.50 US Dollars. Yes, this is the most expensive one but the least amount of travel time, the flight is only 15 minutes...For both of these I am more than happy to book it for you, just let me know. ..Once on the island, you will need a golf cart, the cost of a golf cart is 225 US Dollars for the entire week, plus taxes, once you rent a golf cart with us, I will be waiting for you at either the San Pedro Airport or the San Pedro Water taxi marina and leading the way to the villa...If you have any other questions, please do let us know

The golf cart rental is not included. The cost on a golf cart for 3 days is 150 us dollars plus taxes. This is a four seater. A six seater would be 200 US plus taxes..Since you are here only forv3 days I would suggest the tour *Grand Slam* and the reason for this is that you get to do almost everything in a day. .Pick up is at 8am, first snorkeling site is the holchan marine reserve and then you head to swim with sharks and rays, after this you will go to Caye Caulker and have lunch and visit the island a bit. (lunch not included)  We then go to feed the tarpons and the last snorkel site will be at the north channel in caye caulker, where if mother nature allows us, you will snorkel with manatees and sea horses..The cost per person is 165 US dollars plus taxes, we do need a minimum of 4 persons to confirm this trip...On the fishing, you can either do a half day fishing for 450 plus taxes or a full day fishing for 650 plus taxes. This price is for the boat and additional persons pay 95 plus taxes...If you want fishing, you can also do a day at sea which includes, fishing, lobster and conch hunting (if in season), snorkeling and a cook off on the beach of everything you caught. The cost on this is 650 US dollars plus taxes for up to 4persons and the additional person pays 95US dollars extra

Hello Sari, ..When we first arrived in Belize, I made sure to ask Terri what time we should take the ferry (which we bought a round trip ticket for to save some $) back to BZE for our noon international flight. She said we have to leave the villa no later than 6am. This was also confirmed with her the afternoon prior to departure via WhatsApp. The morning of our departure turned out chaotic. We planned to catch the 7am ferry to Belize City. We didn’t leave the villa until 6:15 because we had to do the final paperwork to pay for our golf cart and wait for Terri to refuel hers. Upon arrival on 9/22, I asked if we could take care of our golf cart paperwork ahead of time, but Terri said it needed to be done closer to our departure date. Instead of alotting extra time for that the morning   of our departure, or even scheduling a time for us to come in the day before, it was initiated at 6 am — the time we were already supposed to be on the road & therefore setting us behind schedule. On the way to the boat dock, Terri decided to give a young girl a ride into town without consulting with us. This indicated a lack of concern for our time. Not only were we already running behind, but picking up the girl to drop her off at an undisclosed location only added to our stress and worry. We understand that it is customary for the locals but we didn’t really have the luxury of time at this point. Needless to say, we missed the 7am ferry by a few minutes. The next one would’ve been at 8:30am. Too late to check in for our noon flight by the time the ferry docks, collect our luggage and take a cab to the airport. Terri said she thought that the ferry would at least wait for us, which we were never under the impression that it would. Plus, that shouldn’t have been a concern since the mutual understanding was to be on time. Terri then suggested we take Maya Air to make our international flight flight by noon. An expense we didn’t foresee nor budgeted for. We had no choice but to purchase our ticket for Maya Air. We would appreciate it if you would reimburse us our ferry tickets and Maya Air tickets with a total of $295.00. This was truly an inconvenience and has put a damper on our trip. ..Thank you...Trish and Da’nelle

OMG that is so amazing...For transportation to the island, there are two options, a water taxi or a plane. The plane is the easiest one, this takes 15 minutes and the cost is 165.50 US Dollars per person round trip..The boat ride is 1 hr 45 minutes, plus a taxi that will take you from the international airport to the water taxi in Belize City which is a 40 minutes ride. The total cost is about 55 US Dollars for the boat per person round trip and 25 US Dollars for two persons for the taxi cab and 10 US Dollars for each additional person...Whichever method you choose, I am more than happy to book, just send me your travel itinerary and names in full.

my top favorite ruin is Lamanai, on this trip, you get picked up at 6:30 in the morning, head to the city where a van awaits to take you 54 miles on the northern highway, at the end of this ride, you will get on a riverboat and go down the river, where if mother nature allows you will see, spider monkeys, howler monkeys, birds, crocodiles, manatees, butterflies, and lots of flora and fauna, after the boat ride, you will hike for 20 minutes and see the Maya Ruin, Lamanai.Costs 220 US Dollars per person, plus taxes. includes, breakfast, and lunch..You can also do the Maya Ruin Xunatunich and join it with either Cave tubing or zip lining, the cost of the two in one day can go from 240 to 260 depending on what you want, or you.can do the three in one day and the cost on this is 285 Plus taxes...Snorkeling at holchan and shark ray alley can be done via catamaran for a full day or on a speed boat for 1/2 day.Caye Caulker sail..On this trip, you will snorkel at two sites, holchan marine reserve, and Shark Ray Alley. We will then head to our beautiful neighboring island Caye Caulker where you will have lunch (not included) and visit the island..We then go back to the boat where we enjoy the music and those delicious rum punches.The cost is 95 plus taxes and park fees, per person.Pick up at 8:30 am and drop off at 4:30 pm..Speed boat -.you choose the time either 8:30 pick up or 1:30 pick up.we go to holchan and shark ray alley and come back home.The cost is 55 plus park fees and taxes..Grand slam - cost is 157.75 per person, need a minimum of 4 people to confirm: this is on a speed boat - leaves at 8 am and returns at 4 pm.We snorkel at holchan, shark ray alley, the north channel in Caye Caulker (high chance of snorkeling with manatees and sea horses), we feed the tarpons and stop for lunch (not included..My top favorite, beach bbq day, the cost is 500 plus taxes, we snorkel, fish, spearfish, lobster hunt, conch hun (Only if in season) and cook everything on the beach when we are done.The price remains the same if 1 or 4 persons go, after 4 then the cost is 75 US Dollars extra per person.for..Please note that prices that I sent you do not include pick up, you would be meeting them in town. If you prefer pick up at the villa, prices will differ a bit..The only trips that will not do pick up will be the Blue Hole and the Catamaran tours

Hi Emily.  I would temper expectations.  There has been an overproduction of saragossum this year.  It's unpredictable and not based on seasons but mother nature.  We do clear the beaches daily weather permitting which is more than most.  We also do have a barrier in place to limit the effects on our shore lines.  The water is still amazing and you can adventure and experience so much flaura and fish! Snorkel with sharks and sting rays or swim with manatees mother nature permitting. So much to be explored and adventured! We have the world's 2nd largest reef in the world just 200 yards from our beach! -- closest point on the entire island except for rocky point.  We're close to 2 of the marine reserves. We also have kayaks and paddle board for you to enjoy!
You also have access to secret beach! 😉 which is a great time!
